alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Western Clay; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 6:43PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bradford, northeastern Alachua, northwestern Putnam and southwestern Clay Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 642 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Keystone Heights, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Keystone Heights, Melrose, Hawthorne, Melrose Landing, George`s Lake, Orange Heights, Lake Geneva, Florahome, Waldo and Hampton. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Western Clay; Western Putnam
